verb.description: Give authorization or consent to (someone) to do something.
examples: the law permits councils to monitor any factory emitting smoke
he would not permit anybody access to the library

noun.description: An official document giving someone authorization to do something.
examples: he is only in Britain on a work permit

phrases: If your Honours will permit me to question all or any of these earlier decisions, I will undertake to advance a sensible argument.
Sir, permit me to observe that the use of force alone is but temporary.
So, while it's still a bit early, permit me to be the first to wish this special astronaut a good journey.
If you will permit me, even though I am a retired politician I would like to say just a word about domestic politics.
origin: Alteration of Spanish palometa little dove.
